string.text: Barkeep: Duty has a reputation to uphold. That's why they want this done quietly. You just need to whack the leader called Lukash, and bring me his PDA as proof...
To join Duty, you will need the approval of one of the most respected fighters in the group. You will also need to prove to Duty's leader that you are worthy of a place in their ranks

Barkeep: Your mission is to kill Tirana, the leader of the Mercs. His crew made it to the Wild Territory, and set up a base in the construction site. Be careful, some of their fighters have set up ambushes along the paths to the site. Bring me Tirana's PDA, and the reward is yours
General Voronin: The war with Freedom is coming to an end. You played your part in fighting for the cause! I want to finish this war. The leader of Freedom must be eliminated...

Captain Ivantsov: Before we jump to any conclusions, you must pass a simple test. Get me a folder from the abandoned building opposite. There's nothing difficult about it. Just go inside, take the folder, and bring it to me. When I have the folder, we'll decide if you're fit to join Duty or not...
Hunter: Please retrieve my rifle. I lost it by the bloodsuckers' lair. I'll upload the coordinates. But don't let the bastards get close to you!

Wolfhound: We've got a little hunt going on here. We pinned the scientists down over there, behind the chopper. My boys are putting fire down on them from time to time, just to make sure they don't escape. Come and join us, we're about to finish 'em off. If you help us, I'll give you the scientist's suit - we found it in the chopper we took down. Your target is Professor Kruglov. Shoot him, or he'll run away during the shootout - I know his type. Keep him for us, and the suit is yours. If he gets away, you don't get anything...

Barkeep: It seems you have the protective prototype to shield against the Brain Scorcher. I know the coordinates of a bunker. Don't forget that the prototype can't protect you from the emissions forever, so you need to get to the bunker under the antennae, and shut down the Scorcher quickly. Then get to the antennae and switch them off, too...
Kruglov: Stalker, help! We were attacked by Mercs, and half our team is dead. Help us! You won't regret it!\n \nBe careful, there must be about fifteen of them, but we don't know for sure...

Kruglov: We were returning from Yantar when the Mercs shot us down. They say they just want information, but I know they'll kill us all to cover their tracks. Escort me to Yantar, and I'll tell you what I know about your Brain Scorcher. Barkeep will pay you well for it. I'm not a good fighter, but I know the way, so I'll lead and you cover us...
Barkeep: If you want to find the missing documents, the scientists will know where Lab X-16 is...

I looked through the documents I found at the Agroprom Institute. It appears that the Institute was used as a front for an unofficial lab called X-18, which hosted a number of highly unusual experiments. Its location isn't clear from the documents, and the Military don't seem to know much about it either. Maybe this is the starting point the traders need. Now I need to travel further North to a certain trader known as the Barkeep

Lab X-18 wasn't fun, and neither were its current residents. I didn't think things like that existed...\nI found some documents. I didn't understand much of what was written in them, except that they contained technical specs for some parts of the Kaymanov emitters.\nWhat's interesting is that those parts were destined for another lab with the codename X-16. Chances are it's a secret one, too

The traders have dug up a lot of information about these labs. The Barkeep wasn't surprised to learn of the emitters and X-16. Now he's convinced that the Brain Scorcher is man-made. He thinks that Lab X-16 is close to the scientists' camp by Lake Yantar.\nIt's interesting that they're studying emissions that resemble the effects of the Scorcher. So now I must pay a visit to the Zone's esteemed scientific community...

I met with Barkeep. Having looked through the documents from the Institute, he thinks that this X-18 lab is in the Dark Valley, and asked me to go there to look for information and documents.
He says he sent Duty scouts to get into the underground vaults there, but none came back. Barkeep thinks they were captured by the Bandits who have a base nearby. If that's true, everything those Duty guys found will be in the hands of Borov, the leader.
Barkeep told me to be careful and... well, clearly he didn't tell me everything about these underground vaults.
Time to get to work. I need to pay Borov a visit, and if our 'encounter' goes well, I'll find a way into the underground...

I'm finally ready to visit the Scorcher. I found out from Crazy the times when the emission levels decrease. Also a safe place where I can wait for these periods to occur. My Psi-protection won't work at other times anyway. I'll need to find a way into the underground bunker of X-10. That's where the controls for the Brain Scorcher antennae should be
